item.title: ShuttleCon Third Edition BTS
item.description:
Missed out on ShuttleCon Third Edition? Then I have good news! We have just uploaded the talks on YouTube

Now you can watch our incredible speakers mastering the basics:

üöÄ From conventional to innovative: Elevate your documentation with Storybook by Andrea L√≥pez Su√°rez üåü Small Changes, Big Impact: Microinteractions in Modern Design by Andrea Delgado Alonso ü§ì Code Review Without Cursing by Noelia Vigil Suarez üí∏Cloud FinOps: Impact in Cost Reduction by Ramiro Alvarez Fernandez üîê Employee User Management: Key Practices and Tools by Daniel Rodriguez Ferrero

We can’t wait to catch you in the next edition ‚Äì stay tuned for more information!

(And for those who couldn’t join us in person, here you have a little summary of how we lived the event at the office ^^)

Original post on LinkedIn here

item.title: ShuttleCon Third Edition has finished
item.description:
This Third Edition of ShuttleCon has been full of surprises. For my side, I wanted to make a more professional event with details, merchandising and bigger communications.

As always, some things did work, and others didn’t, but everyone smiled and said, “Thank you” when the event ended.

The most important thing was that all the speakers were happy. Pablo and I wanted this event to be the first step for people to start giving speeches about what they are doing. Many people are incredible, and you can lose track of time just by listening to them.

One edition has passed, but the next one is going to be even better ;) Maybe you could participate in it…

PD: I want the resources we created to be remembered, so here I leave the whole video we put at the start of the event.

Original post on LinkedIn here

Video by Pablo Ca√±al Su√°rez, ShuttleCon branding by Pablo Gonz√°lez Armengol

item.title: ShuttleCon Third Edition
item.description:
Hey, tech enthusiasts and event aficionados!

My job isn’t just about coding and designing software. I can also do one of the things I like most: Organising events.

Last year, I was one of the speakers at the opening of Empathy.co ShuttleCon, an event with talks that repeats every few months, each with a fresh theme. It was a fantastic experience!

I liked it so much that I couldn’t help but become part of the organisation team for the second edition in April with Pablo Ca√±al Su√°rez. And now… we are bringing you the third edition!

The ShuttleCon is back! This time, we’re diving deep into the roots with the theme “Mastering the Basics”, because you must first have an excellent base to become the best.

We will have six excellent speakers introducing us to various technologies and themes: Noelia Vigil Suarez, Ricardo Soto Est√©vez, Andrea L√≥pez Su√°rez, Ramiro Alvarez Fernandez, Daniel Rodriguez Ferrero and Andrea Delgado Alonso.

The event will be onsite on Empathy.co Headquarters in Gij√≥n, but also streamed on Twitch!

Save the date ‚Äì November 30th, 17:30 CET. Head to our event page for more information, the form to attend onsite and the reveal of talks’ titles. üòâ

Get ready for an evening of tech talk, inspiration, and a surprise or two. See you at ShuttleCon 3.0 üöÄüåê

Original post on LinkedIn here

ShuttleCon branding by Pablo Gonz√°lez Armengol
